00012 /*!\fn double distance( VECTOR3D p1 , VECTOR3D p2 )
00013  *\brief compute the distance between two VECTOR3D points
00014  *\param p1 The first point
00015  *\param p2 The second point
00016  *\return The computed distance
00017  */
00018 double distance( VECTOR3D p1 , VECTOR3D p2 )
00019 {
00020    return sqrt( ( p1[ 0 ] - p2[ 0 ] )*( p1[ 0 ] - p2[ 0 ] ) + ( p1[ 1 ] - p2[ 1 ] )*( p1[ 1 ] - p2[ 1 ] ) + ( p1[ 2 ] - p2[ 2 ] )*( p1[ 2 ] - p2[ 2 ] ) );
00021 } /* distance(...) */

00025 /*!\fn int update_physics_position_nb( PHYSICS *object , int it , double delta_t )
00026  *\brief Update object position componant. 
00027  *\param object The object physics to update
00028  *\param it Componant of VECTOR3D to update. it values : 0 -> x, 1 -> y , 2 -> z 
00029  *\param delta_t Elapsed time since last call for componant update computing
00030  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00031  */
00032 int update_physics_position_nb( PHYSICS *object , int it , double delta_t )
00033 {
00034    __n_assert( object , return FALSE ); 
00035 
00036    object -> speed[ it ] = object -> speed[ it ] + ( object -> acceleration[ it ] * delta_t )/ 1000000.0 ;
00037    object -> position[ it ] = object -> position[ it ] + ( object -> speed[ it ] * delta_t ) / 1000000.0  + ( object -> acceleration[ it ] * (delta_t / 1000000.0 ) * ( delta_t / 1000000.0 ) ) / 2.0 ;
00038 
00039    return TRUE ;
00040 } /* update_physics_position_nb(...) */
00041

00043 
00044 /*!\fn int update_physics_position_reverse_nb( PHYSICS *object , int it , double delta_t )
00045  *\brief Update object position componant, reversed. 
00046  *\param object The object physics to update
00047  *\param it Componant of VECTOR3D to update. it values : 0 -> x, 1 -> y , 2 -> z 
00048  *\param delta_t Elapsed time since last call for componant update computing
00049  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00050  */
00051 int update_physics_position_reverse_nb( PHYSICS *object , int it , double delta_t )
00052 {
00053    __n_assert( object , return FALSE ); 
00054 
00055    object -> position[ it ] = object -> position[ it ] - ( ( object -> speed[ it ] * delta_t ) / 1000000.0  + ( object -> acceleration[ it ] * (delta_t/1000000.0) * (delta_t/1000000.0 ) ) / 2.0 );
00056    object -> speed[ it ] = object -> speed[ it ] - ( object -> acceleration[ it ] * delta_t )/ 1000000.0 ;
00057    object -> angular_speed[ it ] = object -> angular_speed[ it ] - ( object -> angular_acceleration[ it ] * delta_t ) / 1000000.0 ;
00058 
00059    return TRUE ;
00060 } /* update_physics_position_reverse_nb */
00061 
00062 
00063 /*!\fn int update_physics_position_reverse( PHYSICS *object , double delta_t )
00064  *\brief Update object position, reversed. Wrapper of update_physics_position_reverse_nb to update each componants.
00065  *\param object The object physics to update
00066  *\param delta_t Elapsed time since last call for componant update computing
00067  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00068  */
00069 int update_physics_position_reverse( PHYSICS *object , double delta_t )
00070 {
00071    for( int it = 0 ; it < 3 ; it ++ )
00072    {
00073       object -> speed[ it ] = -object -> speed[ it ] ;
00074       object -> acceleration[ it ] = -object -> acceleration[ it ] ;
00075 
00076       update_physics_position_nb( object , it , delta_t );
00077 
00078       object -> speed[ it ] = -object -> speed[ it ] ;
00079       object -> acceleration[ it ] = -object -> acceleration[ it ] ;
00080    }
00081    return TRUE ;
00082 } /* update_physics_position_reverse(...) */
00083 
00084 
00085 
00086 /*!\fn int update_physics_position( PHYSICS *object , double delta_t )
00087  *\brief Update object position, reversed. Wrapper of update_physics_position_reverse_nb to update each componants.
00088  *\param object The object physics to update
00089  *\param delta_t Elapsed time since last call for componant update computing
00090  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00091  */
00092 int update_physics_position( PHYSICS *object , double delta_t )
00093 {
00094    object -> delta_t = delta_t ;
00095    for( int it = 0 ; it < 3 ; it ++ )
00096    {
00097       update_physics_position_nb( object , it , delta_t );
00098    }
00099    return TRUE ;
00100 }

00104 /*!\fn int same_sign( double a , double b )
00105  *\brief Quickly check if two walue are the same sign or not 
00106  *\param a first value
00107  *\param b second value
00108  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00109  */
00110 static int same_sign( double a , double b )
00111 {
00112   return (( a * b) >= 0 );
00113 } /* same_sign(...) */

00117 /*!\fn int vector_intersect( VECTOR3D p1 , VECTOR3D p2 , VECTOR3D p3 , VECTOR3D p4 , VECTOR3D *px )
00118  *\brief Compute if two vectors are intersecting or not
00119  *\param p1 First point of vector 1
00120  *\param p2 Second poinf of vector 1
00121  *\param p3 First point of vector 2
00122  *\param p4 Second point of vector 2
00123  *\param px Storage for the eventual point
00124  *\return VECTOR3D_DONT_INTERSECT , VECTOR3D_COLLINEAR or VECTOR3D_DO_INTERSECT
00125  */
00126 int vector_intersect( VECTOR3D p1 , VECTOR3D p2 , VECTOR3D p3 , VECTOR3D p4 , VECTOR3D *px )
00127 {
00128    double a1 = 0 , a2 = 0 , b1 = 0 , b2 = 0 , c1 = 0 , c2 = 0 ,
00129           r1 = 0 , r2 = 0 , r3 = 0 , r4 = 0 , 
00130           denom = 0 , offset = 0 , num = 0 ;
00131 
00132    /* Compute a1, b1, c1, where line joining points 1 and 2 is
00133       "a1 x + b1 y + c1 = 0". */
00134    a1 = p2[ 1 ] - p1[ 1 ];
00135    b1 = p1[ 0 ] - p2[ 0 ];
00136    c1 = (p2[ 0 ] * p1[ 1 ]) - (p1[ 0 ] * p2[ 1 ]);
00137 
00138    /* Compute r3 and r4. */
00139    r3 = ((a1 * p3[ 0 ]) + (b1 * p3[ 1 ]) + c1);
00140    r4 = ((a1 * p4[ 0 ]) + (b1 * p4[ 1 ]) + c1);
00141 
00142    /* Check signs of r3 and r4. If both point 3 and point 4 lie on
00143       same side of line 1, the line segments do not intersect. */
00144    if((r3 != 0) && (r4 != 0) && same_sign(r3, r4))
00145    {
00146       return VECTOR3D_DONT_INTERSECT;
00147    }
00148 
00149    /* Compute a2, b2, c2 */
00150    a2 = p4[ 1 ] - p3[ 1 ];
00151    b2 = p3[ 0 ] - p4[ 0 ];
00152    c2 = (p4[ 0 ] * p3[ 1 ]) - (p3[ 0 ] * p4[ 1 ]);
00153 
00154    /* Compute r1 and r2 */
00155    r1 = (a2 * p1[ 0 ]) + (b2 * p1[ 1 ]) + c2;
00156    r2 = (a2 * p2[ 0 ]) + (b2 * p2[ 1 ]) + c2;
00157 
00158    /* Check signs of r1 and r2. If both point 1 and point 2 lie
00159       on same side of second line segment, the line segments do
00160       not intersect. */
00161    if( (r1 != 0) && (r2 != 0) && same_sign(r1, r2) )
00162    {
00163       return VECTOR3D_DONT_INTERSECT;
00164    }
00165 
00166    /* Line segments intersect: compute intersection point. */
00167    denom = (a1 * b2) - (a2 * b1);
00168 
00169    if( denom == 0 )
00170    {
00171       return VECTOR3D_COLLINEAR;
00172    }
00173 
00174    if( denom < 0 )
00175    { 
00176       offset = -denom / 2; 
00177    } 
00178    else
00179    {
00180       offset = denom / 2 ;
00181    }
00182 
00183    /* The denom/2 is to get rounding instead of truncating. It
00184       is added or subtracted to the numerator, depending upon the
00185       sign of the numerator. */
00186    num = (b1 * c2) - (b2 * c1);
00187    if(num < 0)
00188    {
00189       (*px)[ 0 ] = (num - offset) / denom;
00190    } 
00191    else
00192    {
00193       (*px)[ 0 ] = (num + offset) / denom;
00194    }
00195 
00196    num = (a2 * c1) - (a1 * c2);
00197    if(num < 0)
00198    {
00199       (*px)[ 1 ] = ( num - offset) / denom;
00200    } 
00201    else
00202    {
00203       (*px)[ 1 ] = (num + offset) / denom;
00204    }
00205 
00206    /* lines_intersect */
00207    return VECTOR3D_DO_INTERSECT;
00208 } /* vector_intersect(...) */
